es.science.title: La ciencia del qì
es.science.subtitle: Fundamentos y beneficios de la práctica.
es.science.qiBody: El qì se refiere a la partícula más pequeña que forma todo en el universo. Maestros chinos observaron que la mente puede reunir, dirigir y transformar el qì; trabajar con él se llama qìgōng.
es.science.qiNote: Nota: Este sitio integra divulgación y referencias científicas. No sustituye asesoría médica.
es.science.znBody: En los años 80, el Dr. Páng He Ming desarrolló zhìnéng qìgōng. La práctica incluye meditaciones, movimientos, sonidos y experimentos con el qì: el qì se hace más abundante, los bloqueos desaparecen y las funciones se fortalecen.

en.hero.title: Qi Science
en.hero.lead: A training and scientific research institution in Zhineng Qigong: a Chinese life philosophy using meditation, movements, sounds and experiments to enhance human capacities.
en.inst.title: Our institution
en.inst.subtitle: What we do and why this project exists.
en.inst.missionBody: We offer workshops in Spanish and English for all ages and develop research projects with institutions and companies to show positive effects of meditation on mind, emotions and body.
en.inst.b1: Clear, accessible explanation of qi and Zhineng Qigong.
en.inst.b3: Scientific research: articles, links and downloadable PDFs.
en.science.title: Qi science
en.science.subtitle: Foundations and reported benefits.
en.science.qiBody: Qi refers to the smallest particle that forms everything in the universe. Ancient Chinese masters observed the mind can gather, direct and transform qi; working with it is called qigong.
en.science.qiNote: Note: This site provides outreach and references. It does not replace medical advice.
en.science.znBody: In the 1980s, Dr. Pang He Ming developed Zhineng Qigong. Practice includes meditations, movements, sounds and qi experiments: qi becomes more abundant, blockages fade and functions strengthen.
